intro: Gomphocarpus multicaulis, commonly known as the spurred tickseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy yellow flowers with distinctive spurred petals. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. It is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
